venue.name: La Sala de Puerto Rico (2nd floor MIT Student Center).

item.description:
Fantasy can mean going about your business and then suddenly bursting into coordinated song and dance with complete strangers! I will be playing violin with the MIT Gilbert & Sullivan Players in their production of "The Grand Duke," the final work by Gilbert & Sullivan.

Plot: the actor Ludwig replaces the company manager Ernest and the miserly Grand Duke Rudolph of Pfennig Halbpfennig after "killing" each of them by drawing the ace from a deck of cards in two statutory duels. By winning the statutory duels, Ludwig assumes all of Ernest's and Rudolph's rights and obligations--i.e., he finds himself engaged/married to multiple women and hilarity ensues.

Friday May 4 is opening night, but I'll also be performing on the following dates:

Friday, May 4, 8:00 PM
Sunday, May 6, 2:00 PM
Thursday, May 10, 8:00 PM
Friday, May 11, 8:00 PM

Tix are $5-$15; if you show them a student ID or look young enough to be a student, it's $5.
http://web.mit.edu/gsp/www/Archive/2012spring_duke/index.html

It will be very easy to find me during intermission and after the show; I'll be one of 5 violinists in the orchestra and playing concertmaster.
item.name: MIT Gilbert & Sullivan Players Present: The Grand Duke
